channel.title: Command prompt at school
channel.description:
This should work on most schools. It should only not work if the computer blocks you from running .bat or .cmd files.
[B]Step 1[/B]
Make a text file with the following code in it and save it as CMD.cmd or CMD.bat
[CODE]@echo off set c= set d= title C:\WINDOWS\system32\cmd.exe echo Microsoft Windows XP [Version 5.1.2600] echo (C) Copyright 1985-2001 Microsoft Corp. echo. :R set c= set /p c="%cd%>" if "x%c%x"=="xx" goto R3 if not "x%c%x"=="xx" goto R4 :R3 %c% goto R :R4 %c% echo. goto R[/CODE]
This should work as a perfect clone of command prompt, any problems let me know. Also, try mucking around and customizing it eg. after this:
[CODE]if "x%c%x"=="xx" goto R3[/CODE]
Put something like this:
[CODE]if "x%c%x"=="xi am coolx" goto IAMCOOL[/CODE]
Then at the bottom put this:
[CODE]:IAMCOOL echo %USERNAME% is really really cool!!! echo. goto R[/CODE]
NOTE: The file name doesn't have to be CMD.cmd or CMD.bat, it was just an example.
[b]Ron: TUT removed from the title of the topic. This is the tutorial section, it's implied.[/b]

item.title: Command prompt at school
item.dc:creator: @wyn10 wyn10
item.description:
@wyn10 wrote:

[quote=“PaulT, post:5, topic:14149”]I used to hack my schools computers by following the administrators around untill they left computers logged on, then I would go on and delete peoples work if I didn’t like them and put sketchy exe files in their place called things like “Gentroj32.exe” etc… Then I made myself tech administrator for the school, set all sharing options so only I could open folders, etc… Kind of obvious who was responsible, afterward, since everything was set so only my account could use it.

Boy I fucked them in the ass. They suspended me for a day, but they made sure that day also happened to be the school Field Day where everyone else went outside and played games and bonded and was happy and joyous and American. I was in the school office cleaning shit off the shit for the obese volunteer mother of somebody I (surprise?) didn’t like. The office refrigator had the teachers yogurt and snacks in it, and I snuck in early the next morning and peed inside of it.[/quote]

wow…what a story

Read full topic

item.title: Command prompt at school
item.dc:creator: @PaulT PaulT
item.description:
@PaulT wrote:

I used to hack my schools computers by following the administrators around untill they left computers logged on, then I would go on and delete peoples work if I didn’t like them and put sketchy exe files in their place called things like “Gentroj32.exe” etc… Then I made myself tech administrator for the school, set all sharing options so only I could open folders, etc… Kind of obvious who was responsible, afterward, since everything was set so only my account could use it.

Boy I fucked them in the ass. They suspended me for a day, but they made sure that day also happened to be the school Field Day where everyone else went outside and played games and bonded and was happy and joyous and American. I was in the school office cleaning shit off the shit for the obese volunteer mother of somebody I (surprise?) didn’t like. The office refrigator had the teachers yogurt and snacks in it, and I snuck in early the next morning and peed inside of it.

Read full topic

item.title: Command prompt at school
item.dc:creator: @krimson_eagl krimson eagl
item.description:
@krimson_eagl wrote:

This should work on most schools. It should only not work if the computer blocks you from running .bat or .cmd files.

Step 1

Make a text file with the following code in it and save it as CMD.cmd or CMD.bat

CODE@echo off
set c=
set d=
title C:\WINDOWS\system32\cmd.exe
echo Microsoft Windows XP [Version 5.1.2600]
echo © Copyright 1985-2001 Microsoft Corp.
echo.
:R
set c=
set /p c="%cd%>"
if “x%c%x”==“xx” goto R3
if not “x%c%x”==“xx” goto R4
:R3
%c%
goto R
:R4
%c%
echo.
goto R[/CODE]

This should work as a perfect clone of command prompt, any problems let me know. Also, try mucking around and customizing it eg. after this:

if "x%c%x"=="xx" goto R3

Put something like this:

if "x%c%x"=="xi am coolx" goto IAMCOOL

Then at the bottom put this:

echo %USERNAME% is really really cool!!!
echo.
goto R[/CODE]

NOTE: The file name doesn’t have to be CMD.cmd or CMD.bat, it was just an example.

Ron: TUT removed from the title of the topic. This is the tutorial section, it’s implied.
